name: Cream Cheese Chicken and Vegetable Soup
ingredients: 2 tablespoons butter 2-‐3 potatoes, peeled and finely diced
1 yellow onion, finely diced 1 cup milk (﴾1% is my milk of choice)﴿
2 cloves garlic, finely minced 4 tablespoons flour
2 stalks celery, diced 1 (﴾8 oz. package)﴿ regular or light cream cheese
1/2 cup diced carrots 2-‐3 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cooked and diced
steps: *Note: this recipe calls for already cooked chicken. I usually cook the chicken breasts in the crockpot with a little chicken
broth the morning I make this soup, but you could also go ahead and cook the chicken in the first step with the
onions and other vegetables that cook together.
In a large pot, melt the butter and add the onion, garlic, celery and carrots. Saute, stirring often, for 3-‐4 minutes, until
the veggies are slightly tender and the onions are translucent. Add the chicken broth and potatoes. Bring the soup to a
simmer and cook, partially covered, until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. In a liquid measuring cup,
vigorously whisk the flour and milk together until smooth. Whisk the mixture into the soup, stirring quickly, and cook
Soften the cream cheese in the microwave until it is very soft/melty. I usually place the unwrapped cream cheese on a
the cream cheese to the soup in small tablespoon-‐size pieces. Let the pieces sit in the soup and warm through then
whisk or stir the soup until the cream cheese melts and mixes in well. Add the cooked chicken and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve.
